I, admittedly, have an emotional attachment to Bitcoin and I'm not willing to let it go so easily.
Bitcoin *has* succeeded, but it's evolving into a place for people with money to store their wealth. I'm becoming excluded.
I want mutual aid societies to make a comeback. And I want LETSystems. All of that and more is possible with Ripple.
XRP is my least favorite thing about Ripple. It's not an "alt" to me. It's a component of a global marketplace I REALLY want to exist.
Bitcoin is becoming unusable for me and I don't let go of things so easily.
I don't expect very many things to make sense to you. For non-mincropayments, I don't want to be forced to lockup my Bitcoin.
Wealthy newcomers seem to be the only ones benefiting from the hard work and grassroots initiatives of early Bitcoiners. I hate that.
I certainly hope not. Ripple is NOT a consumer facing product. It's back-end infrastructure.
Formal specs? Lightning seems similar to # ILP, except with unnecessarily complex code to accommodate the limitations of Bitcoin script.
It's not the same. Early Bitcoiners worked really hard getting merchants on board. Retailers are giving up. I don't see alts having a chance
